questions.question: He eats nothing ………………. burgers.
questions.description: But can mean except after words like all, none, nothing, any etc.

questions.question: Can you ………………………… the car to the service center tomorrow?
questions.description: Take is used for movements to places where neither the speaker nor the listener is.

questions.question: Shaheen has agreed to ……………………………. her camera.
questions.description: We use bring for movement to a place where the speaker or the listener will be.

questions.question: I always ………………………….. before I go to bed.
questions.description: Bathe means to take a bath.

questions.question: I felt …………………………….. I was fainting.
questions.description: As if and as though mean the same. We use them to talk about what a situation seems like.

questions.question: You can stay in my apartment …………………………….. we split the rent.
questions.description: All of these expressions are used to state conditions.

questions.question: She said that she would bring along ………………………………
questions.description: The articles cannot be used with possessives. Instead we use a structure with ‘a …. of mine/yours/hers etc.’

questions.question: This is my phone. Where is ………………………………?
She lived …………………………….. in a small town.
questions.description: The correct expression is determiner + whole + noun.

questions.question: It took two times ………………………… .. I had expected.
Each of us ……………………………… problems.
questions.description: A verb after each of is usually singular however, it can be plural in a more informal style.

questions.question: …………………………….. bad health, she quit her job.
